title: PROGRAM 3: FITNESS FOCUSED
subtitle: Weeks 1-4: Structure Building
subtitleDescription: This phase introduces structured training splits and establishes the rhythm of serious training. Week 4 is your first deload week, teaching you the importance of planned recovery.
videoDescription: Learn the fundamental movement patterns that build true functional strength: squat, hinge, push, pull, carry, and rotate. These movements translate directly to real-life activities and athletic performance.
description: This advanced 12-week program implements proper periodization with built-in deload weeks every fourth week. It uses structured strength training splits, combines steady-state and interval cardio, and includes active recovery. This is where your exercise shifts from general health to specific fitness improvements, preparing you for ongoing advancement in the months to follow.

sections.title: Phase Goals
items: Can complete 30 minutes continuous cardio comfortably
Build aerobic base with longer cardio sessions

items.text: Daily Step Target: 8,000 steps per day

children: Bench press or push-ups (4 sets x 8-10)
Pull-ups or lat pulldowns (3 sets x 8-12)
Leg press or lunges (3 sets x 10-12)

items.text: Saturday - Optional Full Body or Rest
Week 4 Deload: Reduce all volume by 30%, maintain intensity

sections.title: Bonus Activities
items: Build aerobic base with longer cardio sessions
Practice mobility work on rest days

closingNote: Functional Fitness Philosophy: These 6 movement patterns aren't gym exercises - they're fundamental human movements you use every day. Squatting is sitting down and standing up. Hinging is picking something off the floor safely. Pushing and pulling open doors and carry groceries. By strengthening these patterns, you're not just building muscle - you're building a body that moves better, feels better, and handles life better. This is fitness with purpose.
